name: Max Weidling
bio: Maker seit Schneider CPC464, Abitur mit 14.400 Baud Modem, Studium ab Windows 3.11. Ingenieur für Theater- und Veranstaltungstechnik, eigene Firma für technische Spezialeffekte auf Veranstaltungen. Nebenberuflich E-Waste Evangelist.

name: Eric Eitel
bio: Eric Eitel kuratiert Technologie-, Kunst- und Kulturprojekte mit einem besonderen Augenmerk auf die Zukuft der Produktion. Er ist Vorstand des Kultur-Think-Tank all2gethernow e.V. und Gründungsmitglied von Music Pool Berlin, einer durch Musicboard Berlin und Europäischen Sozialfonds geförderten Beratungsstelle für Musikerinnen und Musiker in Berlin. Neben seiner kuratorischen Arbeit publiziert Eric Eitel Beiträge für Technologie- und Musikfachmedien, berät Unternehmen und Organisationen bei der inhaltlichen Positionierung und strategischen Kommunikation und twittert obsessiv als @alias_eitel. --- Eric Eitel is a curator of technology, art and cultural projects with an emphasis on the future of production. He is a board member of all2gethernow, a Berlin based culture think tank, and co-founder of Music Pool Berlin, a consulting platform for musicians and people working in the music business funded by the European Social Fund and Musicboard Berlin. Eric Eitel publishes articles for technology and music media, advises companies and organizations on content positioning and strategic communication, and tweets obsessively as @alias_eitel.

name: Janne Steenbeck
bio:

name: Julia Kapelle
bio:
Seit 2014 ist TRICKMISCH- das mobile Sprachlabor - berlinweit unterwegs, um gemeinsam mit internationalen Sprachschüler*innen eine interaktive Trickfilm-Sprachschule aufzubauen.

TRICKMISCH: Mit unserem Trickkoffer voller Figuren und Kameras in der Tasche zeigen wir Willkommensschüler*innen wie sie eigenen Geschichten, Sach- oder Poesiefilmen produzieren können.  Dafür werden Bilder gezeichnet, als Schattensilhouetten ausgeschnitten, im Legetrick-Verfahren Foto für Foto auf einem Leuchttisch animiert und live vertont.

Schon über 100 Trickfilme sind im Trickmisch KINO zu sehen.

https://trickmisch.de/

https://blog.trickmisch.de/

TRIXMIX: Die analoge Trickmisch-Methode haben wir online mit dem Tool TRIXMIX.TV für alle zugänglich gemacht.  Alle entstandenen Scherenschnitte werden im mehrsprachigen Bildwörterbuch gesammlt und können online animiert werden. Alle von den Filmemacher*innen erschaffenen Zeichnungen, Scherenschnitte, Bildhintergründe, Geräusche online zu neuen Trickfilmen kombiniert werden.

https://trixmix.tv/
links: hier sind alle analog am Leuchttisch entstanden Filme zu sehen, hier ist eine Dokumentation der berlinweiten Aktionen , hier sind alle online erstellen Trickfilme, hier kannst du selber einen Trickfilm machen

name: Ulrich Tausend
bio: Der Soziologe Ulrich Tausend erstellt seit dem Verkauf seiner Onlinespiele Firma Neodelight.com im Jahr 2008 Lernspiele und konzipiert medienpädagogische Projekte. Er ist medienpädagogischer Referent am JFF - Institut für Medienpädagogik. Außerdem malt er mit Licht wie beim Lightpainting Weltrekord auf der re:publica 15 (www.1000lights.de/rp15/) und macht Appmusik (www.tausend-medien.de/appmusik).
links: Webseite, Light Painting Webseite, Twitter Ulrich1000, A Light To Remember (Lightpainting Events)

name: Alexander Katzmann
bio: Alexander Katzmann hat vieles ausprobiert: „Best-Boy“ an Filmsets, Lichttechniker am Theater, Choreografie an der Palucca in Dresden und fünf Studiengängen an der FU Berlin. 2014 entschied er sich für Gesellschafts- und Wirtschaftskommunikation und schreibt seitdem über Journalismus, urbane Provokationen und - sein Name verpflichtet - über Cat Content.

name: Lukas Moessner
bio:
Hi there, 

I have a background in Design Thinking, Team Development and Communication Consulting. When I'm not busy with any of those things I study communication at the University of Arts, Berlin. I find it very fascinating to learn about new Trends and see their impact on the world.

name: Nicolai Sowade
bio: www.ubertrumpfen.de

name: agnes varnai
bio: Agnes Varnai studied Fashion at the University of Applied Arts Vienna under Hussein Chalayan and Bernhard Willhelm. She had several exhibitions in Austria and Hungary and worked in the design team of the Chalayan Studio in London. Her work is a constant search for the untold stories about the human nature. She investigates them without fondness but adds her unique dark sense of humor. Varnai lives and works between Vienna, Austria and Budapest, Hungary.

name: Isak Han
bio:
Isak Han  is an artist, designer, composer, instrument inventor, live performer.

He studied Product Design and Generative/Computational Arts at UdK Berlin. Raised by Korean punk music and an academic education in sculpture, he came to Berlin to study, and ventured into the Berlin club music scene as a DJ. After immersing himself into generative/computational arts practices, he composes his music mainly by means of hardware circuit bending, software programming and personal instrument design. Currently, he is establishing his own company with Hannes Hoelzl to make innovative instruments available to the market. 

Airborne Instruments is the joint venture of Isak Han (KOR) and Hannes Hoelzl (I) who share their passion for electronic musics with a distinctive flavour.

name: Kathrin Passig
bio: Kathrin Passig lebt in Berlin vom Schreiben von Sachbüchern und anderen zweifelhaften Tätigkeiten. Zuletzt erschien Ende 2013 das auf der re:publica 2010 für "diesen Herbst" angekündigte "Weniger schlecht programmieren" (O'Reilly Verlag, zusammen mit Johannes Jander), außerdem zwischen 2014 und 2019 sechs E-Book-Ausgaben des Gemeinschaftsblogs "Techniktagebuch".

name: Eléna Gómez Alvarez
bio: Eléna Gómez Alvarez geb. 03.01.1996, Berlin, studiert sein Oktober 2018 an der Humbolt Universität Berlin Regionalstudien Asien/Afrika. Sie arbeitet seit 2014 als freischaffende Schauspielerin und Performerin und hat bereits an Projekten in der Volksbühne, am Deutschen Theater Berlin und am Maxim Gorki mitgearbeitet. Ihre letzte Performance war im Haus der Kulturen der Welt, als Mitglied der "Picture Band" von Dennis Loesch, im Rahmen den Festivals "100 Jahre Copyright". 2019 wird man Eléna, in dem Spielfilm "Dawn Breaks behind the Eyes" von Kevin Kopacka, in der Rolle der Marion sehen.

name: Kathrin Passig
bio: Kathrin Passig lebt in Berlin vom Schreiben von Sachbüchern und anderen zweifelhaften Tätigkeiten. Zuletzt erschien Ende 2013 das auf der re:publica 2010 für "diesen Herbst" angekündigte "Weniger schlecht programmieren" (O'Reilly Verlag, zusammen mit Johannes Jander), außerdem zwischen 2014 und 2019 sechs E-Book-Ausgaben des Gemeinschaftsblogs "Techniktagebuch".

name: Bruno Pilz
bio: Bruno Pilz is developing interactive audio-games and guides. The former magician and puppeteer manipulates his audience into psychedelic AR-adventures. After years of producing sight specific performances for very small audiences only, his newest audio-game „Bämory" is his first massive-multiplayer-game that can be played anywhere.

name: Tomas Mosa
Stella Schiffczyk
bio: Stella Schiffczyk ist selbstständige Grafikerin aus Berlin. Seit 2015 begleitet sie zeichnerisch Untersuchungsausschüsse im Deutschen Bundestag.
links: Podcast zum 1. Untersuchungsausschuss , Stellas Website VEITH YÄGER

name: Salomon Hörler
bio: Geboren in Köln, studiert in Berlin, lebt Salomon heute im Internet. Hier setzt er sich mit Netzpolitik, sozialen Netzwerken und der digitalen Zukunft des Journalismus auseinander. In seinem Studium der Gesellschafts- und Wirtschaftskommunikation hat er sich mit Kommunikation, Konsum und der nächsten Öffentlichkeit beschäftigt. Aktuell arbeitet er für ZEIT ONLINE und studiert im Master an der Universität der Künste in Berlin.

name: Julia Schneider
bio:
Areas of interest:
- Artificial intelligence, data science and data strategy;
- Innovation processes with a focus on digitalization, diversity and inclusion, research and development;
- Labor economics and health at work.
As an independent consultant for Artificial Intelligence, she supports companies and institutions to shape their ideas about data potential, use cases and business relevance. As an author, she is currently finishing a comprehensive comic contribution on AI. As a member of the scientific committee of VDEI Association of the Exoskeleton Industry e.V., Julia coordinates VDEI's efforts for the acceptance and broad application of exoskeletons in everyday life, the public, politics and science.
Julia studied economics at the Free University in Berlin, Germany, and Santiago de Chile. After working as a labor market researcher for various years, she  received her doctorate from the Free University for her research on the effects of the 2005 German labor market reforms on welfare recipients` behavior and health. After that, she worked as a postdoctoral researcher on empirical labor and innovation research, with a focus on R&D, diversity and inclusion, labor market conditions/health at work and digitization at IAB, Berlin School for Economics and Law and Stifterverband and as senior data strategist at data & analytics company INWT statistics. Her publications are listed on ResearchGate (https://www.researchgate.net/profile/Julia_Schneider), and she tweets as @docjsnyder.

name: Kristina Sinn
bio: Kristina Sinn leitet die Kunstvermittlung im Kunstverein Hannover. Zuvor war sie Kunstvermittlerin am ZKM | Zentrum für Kunst und Medientechnologie Karlsruhe und beteiligt an der inhaltlichen Entwicklung und Durchführung des Vermittlungsprogramms. Sie studierte an der Burg Giebichenstein Kunsthochschule Halle und an der Carl von Ossietzky Universität Oldenburg und beschäftigt sich mit Modellen der Kunstvermittlung, die sich aus der aktiven Teilhabe an der künstlerischen Handlung generieren.

name: Bruno Pilz
bio: Bruno Pilz is developing interactive audio-games and guides. The former magician and puppeteer manipulates his audience into psychedelic AR-adventures. After years of producing sight specific performances for very small audiences only, his newest audio-game „Bämory" is his first massive-multiplayer-game that can be played anywhere.

name: Felix Haas
bio:
In 2011, I moved to Berlin to study languages with a focus on Gender & Women's Studies. To deepen my academic research, I later got the chance to study at UC Berkeley. 

Now I am a master's student of Communication in Social and Economic Contexts at University of the Arts Berlin. My current projects focus on zeitgeist, hypes and psychological implications of digitization. 

I also work as a writer and have been with creative business consultancy u-institut for the past couple of years.

name: Jakob Tengler
bio: Designing digital products - currently for the German social network Jodel. "Communication in social and economic context" (Master) at the UdK Berlin.

name: Karolin Drzensla
bio: Certified Systemic Coach & Graduate in Business Psychology. Currently working at Audible in SEA/SEO Marketing and doing a Master degree in Social and Business Communications at the Berlin University of the Arts. Fascinated by exploring how we as individuals and as a society are affected by media on a meta and micro level. Being eager to find out which tools and gamification strategies could help us to deal with the inevitable shift into a digitalized world.

name: Bruno Gola
bio: Code, sound and media artist from São Paulo, Brazil currently living and studying Art&Media at UdK Berlin.

name: Catharina Alva Bruns
bio:
[nower] currently deep involvend in breaking the waves | M.a. communication in social and economic contexts \ UdK Berlin

[now] project manager realisation of exhibitions (since 2010 \ currently part-time)

[pastly] focus on communication of knowledge | B.a. communication studies \ FU Berlin

[pastlier] Veranstaltungskauffrau | Molitor Berlin
links: Future Shocks, Molitor GmbH - art in motion

name: Simon Mayer
bio: erare human est

name: Cammack Lindsey
bio: They begin at the transition of opera into musical theater, trading in lavish productions to concentrate on marginalized narratives. From embedded pasts and perspectives of ghosts, we examine this space to redistribute stolen futures and individual configurations. Experimenting with subtractions in color space, sound, narration and performance, we blur our reliance on visual systems.  Our most recent research focus is man’s fear of the other and micro algae’s subjugation of our synthetic realities. Cammack Lindsey currently studies for their masters in Art + Media at UdK, Berlin.

name: Nadine Köhne
bio:
Philosophische Beratung, Training & Qualitätsmanagement

  • Promotion in Philosophie, Humboldt-Universität zu Berlin (2014)
  • 1. Staatsexamen in Germanistik und Philosophie, Universität Bonn (2008)

name: Anton Krause
bio: Anton Kurt Krause was born in Magdeburg in 1986. He founded the  ‘Improv(is)e your life’ theatre festival in 2004, spent a year working as an assistant director at the Altmark Theatre and from 2008 to 2011 he studied Directing under Luk Perceval at the Academy of Performing Arts in Baden-Württemberg. Anton Kurt Krause has been an assistant director at Thalia since the 2011/12 season, where he has worked with the likes of Jan Bosse, Stefan Pucher, Nicolas Stemann and Jette Steckel. Alongside his own productions at Thalia, such as the monologue series ‘Schöner Scheitern’ at Nachtasyl, Anton Kurt Krause staged the pilot episode of Thalia soap ‘Rennbahn der Leidenschaft’ and also produced the classroom play that premiered during the 2014 "Lessingtage". Together with the machina eX collective and the theatre of Leipzig he worked on a live point and click adventure. He lives in Berlin and his shows are seen in Leipzig, Cali(Columbian), Dresden, Hamburg and Berlin. Since 2018 he studies the master program “Spiel&&Objekt” at the Hochschule für Schauspielkunst “Ernst Busch”.

name: Nina Prader
bio: NINA PRADER ist eine Künstlerin, Texterin und Referentin, die sich auf alternative Medien und Verlagspraktiken spezialisiert hat.

name: Valentin Zick
bio: MA student of Communications in social and economic contexts at University of Arts Berlin. Currently exploring what comes after post modernism at a box factory.

name: Leoni Voegelin
bio: Leoni Voegelin has studied Art History and History in Basel, Switzerland. After some projects in the field of video art she began with the Master program "Spiel&&Objekt" at the HfS Ernst Busch in Berlin. In her artistic research she questions the nature of human society, the influence of the Anthropocene on nature and the generation of Hybrids and Cyborgs that where raised out of our interwind living on this planet.

name: Meg Sherman
bio: As a graduate in postgraduate research, working as a freelance independent analyst and essayist for six years. I am a campaigner interested in civil liberties.

name: Marta Magnuszewska
bio: I work as a Serious Game Designer and Front-end Web Developer in the Centre for Systems Solutions. I design and moderate social simulations. I'm passionate about our world, art, and interdisciplinarity. Currently, I live in Vienna and study Cross-Disciplinary Strategies.

name: Lisa Baier
bio: As a student of communication in social and economic context at UdK Berlin (BA and now MA), I think about the consequences of (technological) innovation in society and culture. I furthermore write about New Work and the future of organisations at Neue Narrative magazine.

name: Claudius Hausl
bio:
Claudius Hausl *1987 Meisterschüler UDK/ Master of Education GYM. Seid einigen Jahren entwickle ich als freiberuflicher Pädagoge und Künstler ein Verständnis von Spielmechanismen und Gruppendynamiken. Dieses Interessenfeld verbindet als roter Faden meine künstlerische und akademische Arbeit.

Meistens setzte ich mich mit kollektiver Kommunikation und denen ihr zu Grunde liegenden Mechanismen auseinander. Anhand einfacher Modelle exploriere ich Mechanismen, die Aktionsräume im Sinne eines Spiels eröffnen und die Möglichkeit bieten, eine große Anzahl von Menschen interaktiv und thematisch zu verbinden.


In verschiedenen Kollektiven, die sich dem Schaffen von kulturellen Freiräumen widmen, versuche ich Systeme zu erarbeiten, um verschiedenste Interessen synergetisch zusammen zu bringen. Bspw. als Gründer und Vorsitzender des Kulturersatz e.V.s. oder dem Kulturverein Neuendorf am See e.V.. Der Kulturersatz e.V. widmet sich u.a. der Eroberung der Berliner Wasserflächen durch DIY-Kulturflöße und einer Interessenvertretung und Vernetzung von Akteuren der Freeopen Air Szene. Der Kulturverein Neuendorf am See e.V. bespielt in Brandenburg einen ehemaligen Campingplatz als interdisziplinäres Zukunfts-Labor.

name: Isak Han
bio:
Isak Han  is an artist, designer, composer, instrument inventor, live performer.

He studied Product Design and Generative/Computational Arts at UdK Berlin. Raised by Korean punk music and an academic education in sculpture, he came to Berlin to study, and ventured into the Berlin club music scene as a DJ. After immersing himself into generative/computational arts practices, he composes his music mainly by means of hardware circuit bending, software programming and personal instrument design. Currently, he is establishing his own company with Hannes Hoelzl to make innovative instruments available to the market. 

Airborne Instruments is the joint venture of Isak Han (KOR) and Hannes Hoelzl (I) who share their passion for electronic musics with a distinctive flavour.

name: Laura Boser
bio: As a master student of communication in social and economic context at university of arts im interested in culture innovation.

name: Ruben Moser
bio: Nothing yet

name: Jan-Henrik Walter
bio: I have a background in the design of interactive media and communication studies: playful solutions for strategic engagement!

name: Lisa Hofer
bio:
Lisa Hofer kreiert Geschichten und thematisiert darin die Entwicklung unserer Gesellschaft und deren Auswirkung. Sie arbeitet spekulativ auf dem Gebiet der menschlichen Kommunikation, sozialer Standards und untersucht das gesellschaftliche Verhalten in (Zukunfts-) Szenarien. In diesen thematisiert sie die Auswirkungen bestehender und neuer Technologien und Trends. Lisa versucht viele kleine bizarre Beispiele zu geben, um auf aktuelle oder zukünftige Situationen hinzuweisen. Hierzu wendet sie die Medien der Illustrationen, der Video- /Fotokunst und des Ausstellungsdesigns an. Lisa Hofer studierte Industriedesign und Design Investigation an der Universität für angewandte Kunst in Wien und hat darüber hinaus in Städten wie New York, Mailand, Wien, Eindhoven und London studiert, gearbeitet und bei Ausstellungen mitgewirkt.

 

Lisa Hofer creates stories and explores the development of our society and its impact. She works and speculates in the field of human communication, social standards and investigates human behavior in (future) scenarios. In these scenarios she focuses on the impact of existing and emerging technologies and trends. Lisa tries to give many small bizarre examples to point to current or future situations. For this she uses the media of illustration, video/photo art and exhibition design. Lisa Hofer studied industrial design and design investigation at the University of Applied Arts in Vienna. She has studied, worked and exhibited in cities such as New York, Milan, Vienna, Eindhoven and London.

name: kathrin hunze
bio: Kathrin Hunze has studied Arts and Media at the University of the Arts in Berlin as well as Communication Design at the HAW Hamburg. During her studies she was concerned with audiovisual media in space and specialized in trans- and interdisciplinary contexts at the department of modern media. Her topics such as social circumstances and phenomena in natural sciences are approached from design- and art-specific angles and put into a new context. In her conceptual works Hunze does not limit herself to a singular and definitive means of presentation, but experiments with analogue and digital media in space and considers the contextual aspect to be an important additional element.
links: molecular machina project, molecular machina workshop, other works

name: Maren Drewes
bio: Maren hat einen guten Riecher dafür, was Menschen brauchen. Deshalb ahnte sie schon während ihres Studiums der Philosophie, dass vielen Organisationen kritisches Denkens helfen würde, wirksamer zu arbeiten. Über die Jahre tüftelte sie dann in diversen Kundenprojekten alltagstaugliche Methoden im kritischen Denken aus, die wir nun regelmäßig anwenden, vermitteln und stetig weiterentwickeln. Marens Moderation ist geprägt von der Theory U, der dialektischen Führung und dem sokratischen Dialog. Partizipative Leitbild- und Strategieentwicklung sind ihre Leidenschaft, besonders komplexe Fälle lassen sie auf Hochtouren laufen. Sie arbeitet gern gebietsübergreifend auf Deutsch, Englisch, Niederländisch oder in einfacher Sprache.

name: Fabian Raith
bio: Fabian Raith lives and works in Berlin. He is performer and and media artist and experiments with immersive plays and narrative spaces. He is currently interested in the changing paradigms of labour and its influences on time. Before he worked at the Schauspielhaus in Hamburg, he studied European Studies in Erfurt, Frankfurt (Oder) and Istanbul and worked on pop music as a field of political expression. He is now student of the masters program Spiel&&Objekt at HfS Ernst Busch.

name: Esther Seyffarth
bio: Esther Seyffarth promoviert in Computerlinguistik. Ihre Hobbys sind Bots bauen und online auf den Buchstaben "e" verzichten.

name: Florian Noel
bio: Veteran Programmer, Artist, Musician..

name: Lena Eikenbusch
organization: The new masters program of the HfS Ernst Busch "Spiel&&Objekt"
bio: Lena Maria Eikenbusch, actress and dancer from Berlin, member of the master program Spiel&&Objekt, studied acting in Munich and dancing in Berlin. She received an award for acting students for the piece “Lulu. Eine Monstretragödie” in 2014. After her engagement in Krefeld and Mönchengladbach, she worked as an independent actress, e.g. with the game theatre group “machina eX” and the Tanzfabrik Berlin.

name: Robert Harting
bio: Hi, von der Universität der Künste und unterwegs für BUFFY ein Spiel für Rauschsimulation und Spekulation.

name: Lena Kadriye Ziyal
bio:
Lena is part of the collectively run content and graphic design agency Infotext in Berlin. She creates design concepts, infographics, icons, illustration and layout - anything but advertisement. As a visual artist, she is working on a comprehensive comic contribution on AI.

Lena studied graphic arts and visual communication at the Kunsthochschule Berlin-Weißensee, the University of Arts (UdK) in Berlin and at the Marmara University Istanbul. Before, she had an education in the area of illustration and drawing at Studio Mustafa Yildirim in Istanbul. She completed her training with a further education in illustration and graphic design at the Atelier Saeed Ensafi (Tehran, Iran).

In 2008, she wrote her first graphic novel "Graustufen" ("Grayscales"). As part of an exchange project with the American University of Beirut (Lebanon), she realized her project "1001 questions - Berlin/Beirut" (2012). Her book "A common visual language" visually reflects her research of the imagary of European anti-austerity movements (2012/13). She contributed to the conference "The Art of Being Many" (Hamburg, 2014) with the iconing artwork "deconstructive proposals".

Before joining infotext she worked as a freelance graphic designer and visual artist. Customers of her freelance activity were among others: glokal e. V., infotext-berlin, INFOGRAFIK.PRO, Morgengrün Kommunikation/ und.Institut für Zukunft Kultur und Zukunftsfähigkeit, Rosa Luxemburg Foundation, medico international, ZiviZ - Zivilgesellschaft in Zahlen, TLGG, Mensch Meier GmBH, Workstation Ideenwerkstatt /HORTIS europe, Marta Ltd, Yargici Konfeksiyon.

name: Kathleen Rahn
bio: Kathleen Rahn (*1973) ist Kunsthistorikerin und Kuratorin für zeitgenössische Kunst. Seit Juni 2014 leitet sie den Kunstverein Hannover, dessen Programm über Einzelpräsentationen hinaus thematische Ausstellungsformate (u. a. zum digitalen Wandel in der Kunst seit 2015) sowie ein breites Vermittlungsangebot umfasst. Kathleen Rahn leitete von 2007 bis 2012 den Kunstverein Nürnberg – Albrecht Dürer Gesellschaft und war zuvor als Kuratorin für die Kunstvereine in Düsseldorf und Aachen tätig (2000–2007). Sie hat Kunstwissenschaften an der Universität Kassel studiert.

name: Florian Noel
bio: Veteran Programmer, Artist, Musician..

name: Daniel Castillo
bio: I wrote an app to show how ridiculous some blockchain startup ideas are.

name: Thanh Hoang Nguyen
bio: Student der Gesellschafts- und Wirtschaftskommunikation an der Universität der Künste Berlin.

name: Hakan Halac
bio: Thinking about music and everything connected to it at every minute of the day. All about the grind.

name: Tina Kult
bio:
Tina Kult was born in Semipalatinsk (KAZ) and grew up in Germany. Studies in digital art at the University of Applied Arts Vienna and in experimental film at Berlin University of the Arts. She deals with sociocultural contexts and societal structures in her works.

www.tinakult.com

name: Hannes Hoelzl
bio:
Hannes Hoelzl studied Sound Engineering at IEM Graz (A) and Audio Design at the HKU Utrecht (NL). The encounter with Michel Waisvisz during his internship at STEIM in the late 90’s sparked his passion for computer based instruments with direct, gestural bodily influence that match acoustic ones in flexibility, maneuvrability and sonic potential.
Hannes has performed his compositions and installed his sonic artworks internationally. He likes teaching advanced audio coding and physical interaction both in workshops around the world, and at the Berlin University of the Arts, where he is an assistant professor.

Airborne Instruments is the joint venture of Isak Han (KOR) and Hannes Hoelzl (I) who share their passion for electronic musics with a distinctive flavour.

name: Franziska Vogt
bio:
DESIGNER, RESEARCHER, ARTIST

 

Design Graduate, Hochschule Pforzheim (Jewellery and Everyday Objects) 

Current Artist in Residence at DTM (Deutsches Technikmuseum)

name: Catalina Gomez Alvarez
bio:
Catalina Gómez Alvarez was born 1994 in Berlin. She studies Product Design at University of Arts Berlin since 2014. During her studies she attended interdisciplinary design,performance and photography classes supervised by Prof. Jozef Legrand and Prof. Erwin Müller. Last year she was on exchange in Vienna at University of Applied Arts supervised by Anab Jain.

She was part of London Design Biennale 2018 for the Austrian Pavillion and presented there together with the Design Investigations Studio After Abundance, a glimpse of life in a changed Austria.

Currently her work „Emoji.me" an interactive object that takes the user on a journey to question the consequences of the usage of emoticons to express emotions digitally is shown in Bogotá at the new art space Estación Terrena.

name: kathrin hunze
bio: Kathrin Hunze has studied Arts and Media at the University of the Arts in Berlin as well as Communication Design at the HAW Hamburg. During her studies she was concerned with audiovisual media in space and specialized in trans- and interdisciplinary contexts at the department of modern media. Her topics such as social circumstances and phenomena in natural sciences are approached from design- and art-specific angles and put into a new context. In her conceptual works Hunze does not limit herself to a singular and definitive means of presentation, but experiments with analogue and digital media in space and considers the contextual aspect to be an important additional element.
links: molecular machina project, molecular machina workshop, other works

name: Marc DaCosta
bio: Marc is a creative technologist and anthropologist living in New York City and the co-founder of Enigma, a 100-person data technology company. Marc holds a doctorate in cultural anthropology from the University of California, Irvine, where his research examined place making practices in the anthropocene. In addition, Marc is a fellow at the Columbia School of Journalism’s Brown Institute for Media Innovation, collaborating with investigative journalists to develop new approaches to data-driven storytelling. Marc has received numerous awards for his work, including fellowships from the National Science Foundation and Intel Labs and has written about technology and society for The New York Times, The Guardian, and elsewhere.

name: Christian Römer
bio:
Christian studierte Theaterregie an der New York University. Im Direktorium der Neuköllner Oper war er als Geschäftsführer tätig. Seit 2011 verantwortet Christian für die Heinrich-Böll-Stiftung den Fachbereich Kultur und Neue Medien. Er ist spezialisiert auf die Entwicklung von neuen Konferenzformaten und entwickelte im Team u.a. die Konferenzen "Mobilize!" und "Theater und Netz" (www.theaterundnetz.de) und Sonderformate wie "Die digitale Müllabfuhr" und "Schauspiel im Livestream". Zentrales Interesse seiner Arbeit ist die Schnittstelle zwischen Netz- und Kulturgesellschaft. Zuletzt inszenierte er an der Neuköllner Oper Berlin das Musiktheaterprojekt "Fuck the facts" von Aufstieg und Fall eines Internetaktivisten und "Die lächerliche Finsternis" von Wolfram Lotz am VAT Teater in Tallinn.

Aktuelle Informationen zu aktuellen Veranstaltungen auf FB

name: Nadja Buttendorf
bio: Nadja Buttendorfs artistic work is an interplay between pop culture and narratives of technological history. Her videos, performances, installations and online interventions discuss social questions about the human body and the often reproduced gender stereotypes. In current works Buttendorf examines the history of computer development in GDR and reflects the situation of woman in technology.
links: artits website, Robotron - a tech opera SEASON 1, b0ring, dead b0ring

name: Maximilian Mors
bio: Studying a Master's degree in "Gesellschafts- und Wirtschaftskommunikation" at the University of the Arts in Berlin!

name: Julian Jungel
bio:
Julian Jungel is a director and coder of the interactive arts. His interest lies in the space where craftsmanship and
sensors, generative design and music, animation and digital technology meet. Here he creates fascinating and fun user
experiences through fast iterations of design and prototyping.
His toolset includes design process skills, hardware hacking techniques to interact with physical objects as well as
classic programming languages like c++ and c#, arduino, processing and vvvv. He visualizes and animates with
Cinema 4D and After Effects.
Julian did his BS in Computer Sciences at Hochschule Ravensburg-Weingarten then worked as a freelance programmer
and 3D-Artist before he joined the Interactive Media class at the Filmakademie Baden-Württemberg from 2010 to
2013. Since 2015 he is senior lecturer on interactive arts at the internationally renowned Animationsinstitut in
Ludwigsburg, Germany.
Furthermore he helped build TINKERTANK, a non-profit initiative aiming to reanimate creativity in kids, youths and
adults with the help of agile technology and curates their workshops on animatronics, robotics, VR, wearables –
anything that can be built from or enhanced with electronic scrap.
Today Julian works as lecturer for creative technology in Puppetry at the Ernst Busch Academy of Dramatic Arts in
Berlin.

name: Hannelore Minks
bio: Hannelore Minks arbeitet als Kulturkoordinatorin für das Schulentwicklungsprogramm SCHULE:KULTUR!2 der Niedersächsischen Landesschulbehörde. Im Rahmen der Tätigkeit entwickelt sie in intensiver Zusammenarbeit mit dem Kunstverein Hannover innovative Projekte mit dem Ziel, Kunst und Kultur fest im schulischen Alltag zu verankern und so ein fächerübergreifendes, kulturelles Bildungsangebot zu schaffen. Des Weiteren ist sie Kunstlehrerin an der Robert-Koch-Realschule Langenhagen und leitet dort den Fachbereich der musisch-kulturellen Bildung. Zudem arbeitet sie als Fachberaterin der musisch-kulturellen Bildung für die Niedersächsiche Landesschulbehörde, Regionalabteilung Hannover. Sie hat Kunst und Geschichte für das Lehramt an Realschulen studiert.

name: Matthias Bauer
bio:
Architekt, 62 Jahre

seit 1980 Spaziergänger am Gleisdreieck

seit 1992 aktiv in den Bürgerinitiativen, die sich für den Park am Gleisdreieck einsetzen

2007 bis 2014 Mitarbeit in der projektbegleitenden Arbeitsgruppe zur Gestaltung des Parks

seit 2009 Herausgeber https://gleisdreieck-blog.de

seit 2014 bis 2019 Mitglied im Nutzerbeirat des Parks

name: Sarah Weber
bio: As a master student of communication in social and economic context at UdK Berlin, i am constantly interested in postmodern pop-culture and technological innovation.

name: Michael Schulte
organization: Klexikon - die erste deutschsprachige Wikipedia-Alternative für Kinder
bio: Journalist. Gründer und Projektleiter des Online-Lexikons @Klexikon und der Hörplattform @Ohrka. Beides kostenlose Angebote für Kinder. Das eine als Alternative zur Wikipedia und das andere als Jederzeit-Hörangebot im Netz. Foto: CC BY SA 4.0 Ziko van Dijk.

name: Hannes Hoelzl
bio:
Hannes Hoelzl studied Sound Engineering at IEM Graz (A) and Audio Design at the HKU Utrecht (NL). The encounter with Michel Waisvisz during his internship at STEIM in the late 90’s sparked his passion for computer based instruments with direct, gestural bodily influence that match acoustic ones in flexibility, maneuvrability and sonic potential.
Hannes has performed his compositions and installed his sonic artworks internationally. He likes teaching advanced audio coding and physical interaction both in workshops around the world, and at the Berlin University of the Arts, where he is an assistant professor.

Airborne Instruments is the joint venture of Isak Han (KOR) and Hannes Hoelzl (I) who share their passion for electronic musics with a distinctive flavour.

name: Linn Filous
bio: As a social and economic communications master student at Berlin‘s University of the Arts and through more than three years of experience in project management and press work, I am excited about the many opportunities that come with technological innovations. I believe that characteristics such as decentralization, ubiquity and international accessibility are important not only in communication, but also in value transfer systems.

name: Alberto de Campo
bio:
Alberto de Campo is Professor for Generative Art / Computational Art at the Institute for Time-Based Media since 2009. His research focuses on computer music and computational art, generative art, audiovisual performances with complex systems, sonification of scientific data and interdisciplinary arts and practices.

He studied jazz guitar, electronic music and composition at the Graz University of Art, undertook research and taught at CREATE, UC Santa Barbara, IEM Graz, KHM Cologne, and hold the Edgard Varèse's guest professor for electronic music at the TU Berlin. From 2005-2007 he was the lead researcher at 'SonEnvir' (IEM Graz), researching the sonification of data for various scientific contexts; For this dissertation (2009). From 2007-2009 he was professor for musicinformatics at the Robert Schumann Hochschule Düsseldorf. From 2013-2016 he was the lead researcher at '3DMIN Design, Development and Dissemination of New Musical Instruments'.

Ausgewählte Publikationen

Bovermann, T., de Campo, A., Egermann, H., Hardjowirogo, S.-I., Weinzierl, S. (Eds.): Musical Instruments in the 21st Century. Identities, Configurations, Practices. New York: Springer, 2017.

de Campo, A; Hentschel, U; King, D; Kufus, A. (Eds). Play:test. Versuche über die Kunst des Experimentierens. Berlin: Verlag der Universität der Künste Berlin, 2013.

Bovermann, T; Rohrhuber, J; de Campo, A. “Laboratory Methods for Experimental Sonification”. In: Hermann, Hunt, Neuhoff (Eds.) The Sonification Handbook. Berlin: Logos, 2011.

de Campo, A. Science By Ear. An Interdisciplinary Approach to Sonifying Scientific Data. PhD thesis, University of Music and Performing Arts, Graz: 2009. 

de Campo, A. “Neue Perspektiven. Generative Methoden in der künstlerischen Praxis”. In: Positionen 99/2014, 6–10 (2014).

de Campo, A. “Lose Control, Gain Influence – Concepts for Metacontrol”. In: Proceedings of ICMC/SMC 2014, Athens, Greece: 2014.

Baalman, M; Bovermann, T., de Campo, A; Negrão, M. “Modality”. In: Proceedings of ICMC/SMC 2014, Athens, Greece: 2014. 

de Campo, A. “Toward a Data Sonification Design Space Map”. In: Proceedings of the 13. International Conference on Auditory Display, 343-347. Montréal: 2007.

de Campo, A; Hoeldrich, R; Eckel, G; Wallisch, A. “New Sonification Tools for EEG Data Screening and Monitoring”. In: Proceedings of the 13. International Conference on Auditory Display, 536-542, Montréal: 2007.

Dayé, C; de Campo, A. “Sounds Sequential: Sonification in the Social Sciences”. In: Interdisciplinary Science Reviews 31:4, 349-364 (2006).

de Campo, A; Rohrhuber, J. “else if – live coding, Strategien später Entscheidung“. In: Fleischmann; Reinhard (Eds.). Medienkunst als Schnittstelle von Kunst, Wissenschaft, Wirtschaft und Gesellschaft. Heidelberg: Whois, 2004.

name: Philipp Rapp
bio: I have a background in communication and management sciences. At the moment I am doing my Masters degree in Communication in Social and Economic Contexts at the University of Arts Berlin. I am excited about digital change and transformation and their impact on organizations.

name: Sarah Wenzinger
bio: Sarah Wenzinger (*1990) is a project director who works with new forms between performance, politics, discourse, and ritual in the intersections of the operating system. Coming from a practically applied artistic background, she studied Directing for theatre at the HFS Ernst Busch in Berlin and has completed interdisciplinary projects in many different contexts. As a feminist and European Democrat, her own work is characterized by a strong political approach. She searches for shapes that offer a greater variety of possibilities in exploring topics, and do not limit the impact from beginning to final stage. She works with performative formats such as interventions, dinners, and performances in institutional, urban underground spaces.

name: Cammack Lindsey
bio: They begin at the transition of opera into musical theater, trading in lavish productions to concentrate on marginalized narratives. From embedded pasts and perspectives of ghosts, we examine this space to redistribute stolen futures and individual configurations. Experimenting with subtractions in color space, sound, narration and performance, we blur our reliance on visual systems.  Our most recent research focus is man’s fear of the other and micro algae’s subjugation of our synthetic realities. Cammack Lindsey currently studies for their masters in Art + Media at UdK, Berlin.

name: Ariane Trümper
bio:
The German scenographer and artist Ariane Trümper (1984) studied fashion design in Berlin and worked for several years as film professional. In 2014 she graduated Cum Laude with a MA Scenography at the Frank Mohr Institute (FMI) in Groningen. During her study she started working with technology, such as camera’s and interactive performance programs and visited additional courses of the IME Master program (Interactive Media and Environments). Ariane is living and working from Rotterdam as an independent artist and scenographer in Germany and the Netherlands.

Her performative installations are researching perceptive and performative processes filtered through our bodies and technology. She is part of the German performance collectives Monster Control District, the Dutch research group Platform-Scenography and regularly tutoring, i.e. at the HKU Utrecht (MA Scenography). She creates autonomous artistic installations, performances and media works.

name: Janne Nora Kummer
bio: Janne Nora Kummer is a director, performer and multimedia artist, based in Berlin.  In her work, she deals with the connection of new media and performance art and the effects of technology and Internet on the individual and society. She teaches and researches within the Master Degree Program Spiel && Objekt at the HfS Ernst Busch. In her research she is critically dealing with body images and power relations, based on gender identities and their (re) production in the analogue and digital world. In addition, she works on a contemporary artistic practice to utilise the subversive and creative potential of new technologies. Her focus lies on the development of alternative narratives and narrative formats that address the complexity of a technological, digitalised  and globalised world and that operate beyond the structures of established power mechanisms. She is alumna of the Studienstiftung des Deutschen Volkes, a permanent member of virtuellestheater and chairperson off the board of virtuellestheater e.V.
links: Homepage virtuellestheater, Studiengang Spiel && Objekt, Homepage Janne Nora Kummer

name: Jascha Jakob Schieche
bio:
Jascha Jakob Schieche lives and works as an artist in Leipzig, Germany and Raab, Austria.

Schieches work deals with structural and aesthetic facets of both digital and analogue games.

name: Ulrich Tausend
bio: Der Soziologe Ulrich Tausend erstellt seit dem Verkauf seiner Onlinespiele Firma Neodelight.com im Jahr 2008 Lernspiele und konzipiert medienpädagogische Projekte. Er ist medienpädagogischer Referent am JFF - Institut für Medienpädagogik. Außerdem malt er mit Licht wie beim Lightpainting Weltrekord auf der re:publica 15 (www.1000lights.de/rp15/) und macht Appmusik (www.tausend-medien.de/appmusik).
links: Webseite, Light Painting Webseite, Twitter Ulrich1000, A Light To Remember (Lightpainting Events)

name: Anna Vera Kelle
bio: Anna Vera Kelle is a theatre maker producing plays for young as well as adult audiences at different theaters among Germany. She is associated with Theater Strahl Berlin, a theatre for a young audience and at the moment she is part of the master's programme „Play && Object“ at HfS „Ernst Busch“ Berlin which focuses on digital media in theatrical contexts.

name: Sandra Mamitzsch
bio: Sandra Mamitzsch is a Berlin based political consultant and activist. She is curating re:publica since 2011 and project lead for Global Innovation Gathering at Careables.org. Prior to that she was a project manager and consultant at newthinking communications, advising on digital media and communication strategies, media and internet policy and creative industries. In her free time, she is an active member of the non-profit organizations “European Digital Rights” (EDRi) and “Digitale Gesellschaft”.

name: Geraldine de Bastion
bio: Geraldine de Bastion is a freelance consultant based in Berlin, Germany. She is an expert on information and communication technology and new media for development and advises organizations such as the German Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development and the Deutsche Gesellschaft für Internationale Zusammenarbeit on digital media and communication strategies. She also works with activists and bloggers around the world. Geraldine is founder of the consultancy Konnektiv GbR. She works as a free curator and moderator for re:publica and other international events. Geraldine has an honorary position as head of board at the German NGO Digitale Gesellschaft e.V. and is an active member of iceBauhaus e.V.. @Geralbine

name: Alexandra Wolf
bio: Art thoerist, internet enthusiast, trash POP lover ... and: Programme Director #rp17 "Love out Loud"  & #rp18 "POP"

name: Sandra Mamitzsch
bio: Sandra Mamitzsch is a Berlin based political consultant and activist. She is curating re:publica since 2011 and project lead for Global Innovation Gathering at Careables.org. Prior to that she was a project manager and consultant at newthinking communications, advising on digital media and communication strategies, media and internet policy and creative industries. In her free time, she is an active member of the non-profit organizations “European Digital Rights” (EDRi) and “Digitale Gesellschaft”.

name: Geraldine de Bastion
bio: Geraldine de Bastion is a freelance consultant based in Berlin, Germany. She is an expert on information and communication technology and new media for development and advises organizations such as the German Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development and the Deutsche Gesellschaft für Internationale Zusammenarbeit on digital media and communication strategies. She also works with activists and bloggers around the world. Geraldine is founder of the consultancy Konnektiv GbR. She works as a free curator and moderator for re:publica and other international events. Geraldine has an honorary position as head of board at the German NGO Digitale Gesellschaft e.V. and is an active member of iceBauhaus e.V.. @Geralbine

bio: Art thoerist, internet enthusiast, trash POP lover ... and: Programme Director #rp17 "Love out Loud"  & #rp18 "POP"
